title: Understanding $$p-value$$
text: A $$p-value$$ is a measure of the probability that an observed difference could have occurred just by random chance. It helps in determining the significance of your results.

title: Significance Level
text: The significance level, often denoted as alpha, is the threshold at which you decide whether a $$p-value$$ indicates a statistically significant result. Commonly, this is set at $$0.05$$.

title: Interpreting $$p-value$$ < $$0.05$$
text: If the $$p-value$$ is less than $$0.05$$, it suggests that the observed data is unlikely under the null hypothesis, leading to the rejection of the null hypothesis.

hintAnswer: There is a statistically significant difference between the sample means.
title: Conclusion from $$p-value$$
text: What conclusion can you draw if the $$p-value$$ is less than $$0.05$$?
choices: There is a statistically significant difference between the sample means.
The sample means are not significantly different.
